gpt_university_description: RWTH Aachen University, founded in 1870, is a leading research university located in Aachen, Germany. The university is well known for its strong focus on engineering, technology, and natural sciences and is one of the largest and oldest technical universities in Germany. It is a member of the TU9, an alliance of nine top German institutes of technology.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Aachen is relatively affordable compared to other German cities, such as Munich or Frankfurt. Students can expect average monthly living expenses of around €800 to €1000, including accommodation, food, transportation, and personal expenses.
gpt_location_weather: Aachen has a temperate oceanic climate with relatively mild winters and cool summers. The average temperature ranges from 3°C in January to 19°C in July, with rainfall evenly distributed throughout the year.
gpt_location_description: Aachen is a historic spa city in western Germany, close to the borders with Belgium and the Netherlands. It is known for its rich history, beautiful architecture, and vibrant cultural scene. Aachen offers a high quality of life and a diverse, international atmosphere due in part to its large student population.
gpt_location_crime: Aachen has a low to moderate crime rate compared to other German cities. Most crimes are related to petty theft, pickpocketing, and vandalism. Taking general safety precautions should minimize any potential risks.
gpt_location_transportation: Aachen's public transportation system includes buses, trams, and regional trains, providing efficient and affordable access to all parts of the city and its surrounding areas. Students can purchase a semester ticket for unlimited travel within the city and throughout the state of North Rhine-Westphalia.
